content: Species of fish The **blue panchax** or **whitespot** (***Aplocheilus panchax***) is a common freshwater fish found in a large variety of [habitats](/wiki/Habitat) due to its high adaptability. This [species](/wiki/Species) is native to southern Asia from [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan), [India](/wiki/India) , [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) to [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia). It has been discovered in two hot springs in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The species also commonly spotted in Johor Bahru rivers and estuaries. Identified by a white-coloured spot on its head, the species can reach up to 9 cm (3.5 in) [in length](/wiki/Fish_measurement); it tends to keep to the surface of the water, and controls the mosquito population by feeding on their larvae. This [Cyprinodontiformes](/wiki/Cyprinodontiformes) article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Blue panchax
